resources.string: Welcome to the Privacy Friendly Werewolf. Here you can start a new game!
Waiting for other players to connect …
Connect to the hotspot "%1$s" with the password %2$s
In order to play the game wifi needs to be activated. Please check if it is enabled. If not please go to the settings and activate it.
In order to play the game wifi needs to be activated. Alternatively, a local-only hotspot can be created to allow playing the game offline.
Something went wrong while trying to create the Hotspot. Please try again or connect to a normal network instead!
You must enable the location service to create a Hotspot!
To have more fun with the game you should at least be 6 players. In spite of that, do you still want to proceed to the game?
Enter the game server\'s ip address and your player name
You are now connected. Please wait for the game to begin.
This is another player\'s card. Try to guess, who is friend and who is foe!
This is your character card. Do you want to know your role?
This will end the game. Your current game status will be lost. Are you sure you want to end the game?
This will end the game. Your current game status will be lost. Are you sure you want to end the game?
In the current round the following player got killed by the werewolfes:
Do you want to save this player\'s life by using your healing elixir?
Do you want to use your poison elixir? If yes, select the player you want to poison.
Daniel Gölz, Tobias Kowalski, Florian Staubach

This application belongs to the group of Privacy Friendly Apps developed by Technische Universität Darmstadt. Sourcecode licensed under GPLv3. Images copyright Florian Staubach, TU Darmstadt and Google Inc.
More information can be found on:
Privacy Friendly Werewolf is an open source implementation of the Werewolf card game. You can play it with your friends inside a WiFi network.
What kind of cards are in the game?
Up to four different roles are randomly assigned to the players. The roles are Villager, Werewolf, Witch and Seer.

The villagers are ordinary citizens. They are afraid of the werewolves but they do not have any power to identify werewolves or protect themselves. The only chance to protect themselves is observing the behaviour of others during the day. Once a day they have an election where all villagers select one person in the village who will be put to death.

The werewolves appear as villagers during the day, but wake up as werewolves at night and kill somebody to satisfy their needs. They do not want to be uncovered and act very shy and innocent during the day. They even accuse others to be the werewolves.

The witch is a mystic person which does not appear special during the day. In the night they prepare potions. The witch can poison someone in the village whom they suspect is a werewolf. Alternatively, the witch can use an elixir to save someone\'s life. Unfortunately the witch is already very old and thus can only prepare one poison and one elixir in a game.

The seer has special powers. Although appearing as a ordinary villager during the day they can reveal one person\'s identity during the night. The seer is able to do this every night as long as they are alive.

When everyone has checked their own identity it is getting dark.
 1. At the beginning, the werewolves awake and hunt somebody down by voting on their smartphone.
 2. The witch will get notified who got killed by the werewolves and chooses whether to use a potion to rescue the killed player or whether to poison somebody.
 3. The seer awakes and can reveal somebody's identity.
 4. During the day phase, all players awake and discuss their opinions of the werewolves' identity.
 After these phases the process starts again.

The game is over, if either the werewolves or the villagers have won. The werewolves win, if the number of living werewolves is greater or equal to the number of living villagers. The villagers win, if all werewolves have died.
Privacy Friendly Werewolf is built to use as few permissions as possible. It further does not include any tracking mechanisms or advertising.
Which permissions are required in the app?
Privacy Friendly Werewolf requires the permission to setup a wifi connection, to search nearby devices and to start a communication channel with them. It does not connect to the internet in any way.
This tutorial will help you to understand the basic game rules of Privacy Friendly Werewolf so that you can start very soon playing it with your friends.
To start a game you have two options.
You can either start a new game waiting for other players to connect or you can connect to an existing game.

During the game you will see a status bar at the top. It displays the current game phase and how much time you have left until the phase is over. The player\'s role cards are displayed at the bottom. You can click your own card, coloured green, to reveal your role.
Look at your role and prepare yourself!
Please specify your player name. You will be the game host.
The brave citizens of the town decided to kill:
The day is over, here is the result
The current number of werewolves is
Specify, if there should be a seer in the game.
Specify, if there should be a witch in the game.
Click here to start the Night —>
Click here to start the Voting —>
Click on a Player\'s Card to see his identity!
The Game will end in a few seconds…
When everyone is ready, press the blue button in the bottom right corner to start the game!
The host has stopped the game. You will be directed to the Main menu shortly…
Click here to start the Game —>
You can\'t poison a dead player
You are about the start the game with following settings:
The given address is not associated with a server. Please check if the host is set and/or if you got the IP address right.
Press OKAY if you are content with these settings.
Specify, if there should be background music playing.
Please enable Wifi and reload the page!
